import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and calculate the number of papers and average citation count
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').agg({'Title': 'count', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'mean'}).reset_index()
yearly_trends.rename(columns={'Title': 'PaperCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'AvgCitationCount'}, inplace=True)

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['PaperCount'], marker='o', label='Number of Papers')
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'], marker='x', label='Average Citation Count')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Research')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.xticks(yearly_trends['Year'])
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Years covered: {yearly_trends['Year'].min()} to {yearly_trends['Year'].max()}")
print(f"Year with most sensemaking papers: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['PaperCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print(f"Year with highest average citation count: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print("### End of facts")

Years covered: 1999 to 2019
Year with most sensemaking papers: 2012
Year with highest average citation count: 2014
### End of facts

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the sensemaking research papers, and how do these affiliations correlate with the citation impact of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract author affiliations and citation counts
affiliations = df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()
citation_counts = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].repeat(affiliations.groupby(level=0).size())

affiliation_citation_df = pd.DataFrame({'Affiliation': affiliations.values, 'CitationCount': citation_counts.values})

# Calculate the most common affiliations and their average citation impact
common_affiliations = affiliation_citation_df['Affiliation'].value_counts().head(5)
avg_citation_impact = affiliation_citation_df.groupby('Affiliation')['CitationCount'].mean().loc[common_affiliations.index]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
print(common_affiliations)
print("\nAverage citation impact of these affiliations:")
print(avg_citation_impact)
print("### End of facts")

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

affiliations = df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()
citation_counts = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].repeat(affiliations.groupby(level=0).size())

affiliation_citation_df = pd.DataFrame({'Affiliation': affiliations.values, 'CitationCount': citation_counts.values})

question.question: How has the frequency of papers on sensemaking evolved over the years in the dataset, and what trends can be observed in terms of publication volume and citation counts?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and calculate the number of papers and average citation count
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').agg({'Title': 'count', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'mean'}).reset_index()
yearly_trends.rename(columns={'Title': 'PaperCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'AvgCitationCount'}, inplace=True)

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['PaperCount'], marker='o', label='Number of Papers')
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'], marker='x', label='Average Citation Count')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Research')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.xticks(yearly_trends['Year'])
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Years covered: {yearly_trends['Year'].min()} to {yearly_trends['Year'].max()}")
print(f"Year with most sensemaking papers: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['PaperCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print(f"Year with highest average citation count: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the sensemaking research papers, and how do these affiliations correlate with the citation impact of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract author affiliations and citation counts
affiliations = df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()
citation_counts = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].repeat(affiliations.groupby(level=0).size())

affiliation_citation_df = pd.DataFrame({'Affiliation': affiliations.values, 'CitationCount': citation_counts.values})

# Calculate the most common affiliations and their average citation impact
common_affiliations = affiliation_citation_df['Affiliation'].value_counts().head(5)
avg_citation_impact = affiliation_citation_df.groupby('Affiliation')['CitationCount'].mean().loc[common_affiliations.index]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
print(common_affiliations)
print("\nAverage citation impact of these affiliations:")
print(avg_citation_impact)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the number of downloads on Xplore and the citation impact of sensemaking research papers, and do papers with higher downloads tend to have higher citation counts?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate correlation between Downloads_Xplore and CitationCount_CrossRef
correlation = sensemaking_papers['Downloads_Xplore'].corr(sensemaking_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Plot the relationship
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=sensemaking_papers, x='Downloads_Xplore', y='CitationCount_CrossRef')
plt.title('Relationship between Downloads and Citation Count for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Downloads on Xplore')
plt.ylabel('Citation Count (CrossRef)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print the correlation result
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Correlation between downloads and citation count: {correlation:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: How has the frequency of papers on sensemaking evolved over the years in the dataset, and what trends can be observed in terms of publication volume and citation counts?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and calculate the number of papers and average citation count
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').agg({'Title': 'count', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'mean'}).reset_index()
yearly_trends.rename(columns={'Title': 'PaperCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'AvgCitationCount'}, inplace=True)

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['PaperCount'], marker='o', label='Number of Papers')
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'], marker='x', label='Average Citation Count')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Research')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.xticks(yearly_trends['Year'])
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Years covered: {yearly_trends['Year'].min()} to {yearly_trends['Year'].max()}")
print(f"Year with most sensemaking papers: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['PaperCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print(f"Year with highest average citation count: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the sensemaking research papers, and how do these affiliations correlate with the citation impact of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract author affiliations and citation counts
affiliations = df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()
citation_counts = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].repeat(affiliations.groupby(level=0).size())

affiliation_citation_df = pd.DataFrame({'Affiliation': affiliations.values, 'CitationCount': citation_counts.values})

# Calculate the most common affiliations and their average citation impact
common_affiliations = affiliation_citation_df['Affiliation'].value_counts().head(5)
avg_citation_impact = affiliation_citation_df.groupby('Affiliation')['CitationCount'].mean().loc[common_affiliations.index]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
print(common_affiliations)
print("\nAverage citation impact of these affiliations:")
print(avg_citation_impact)
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What is the relationship between the number of downloads on Xplore and the citation impact of sensemaking research papers, and do papers with higher downloads tend to have higher citation counts?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
sensemaking_papers = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Calculate correlation between Downloads_Xplore and CitationCount_CrossRef
correlation = sensemaking_papers['Downloads_Xplore'].corr(sensemaking_papers['CitationCount_CrossRef'])

# Plot the relationship
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.scatterplot(data=sensemaking_papers, x='Downloads_Xplore', y='CitationCount_CrossRef')
plt.title('Relationship between Downloads and Citation Count for Sensemaking Papers')
plt.xlabel('Downloads on Xplore')
plt.ylabel('Citation Count (CrossRef)')
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

# Print the correlation result
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Correlation between downloads and citation count: {correlation:.2f}")
print("### End of facts")

insights: The dataset reveals a strong positive correlation (0.74) between the number of downloads on Xplore and the citation count of sensemaking research papers. This suggests that papers which are downloaded more frequently tend to also have higher citation counts, indicating a potential relationship between the accessibility or popularity of a paper and its academic impact.

The correlation implies that researchers and practitioners may be more likely to cite papers that are easily accessible or widely read, as indicated by the download numbers. This could be due to the increased visibility and dissemination of these papers within the academic community.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['Title'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Group by year and calculate the number of papers and average citation count
yearly_trends = df_sensemaking.groupby('Year').agg({'Title': 'count', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'mean'}).reset_index()
yearly_trends.rename(columns={'Title': 'PaperCount', 'CitationCount_CrossRef': 'AvgCitationCount'}, inplace=True)

# Plot the trends
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['PaperCount'], marker='o', label='Number of Papers')
plt.plot(yearly_trends['Year'], yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'], marker='x', label='Average Citation Count')
plt.title('Trends in Sensemaking Research')
plt.xlabel('Year')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.xticks(yearly_trends['Year'])
plt.show()

# Print facts
print("### Begin of facts")
print(f"Total sensemaking papers: {len(df_sensemaking)}")
print(f"Years covered: {yearly_trends['Year'].min()} to {yearly_trends['Year'].max()}")
print(f"Year with most sensemaking papers: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['PaperCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print(f"Year with highest average citation count: {yearly_trends.loc[yearly_trends['AvgCitationCount'].idxmax(), 'Year']}")
print("### End of facts")

question.question: What are the most common author affiliations in the sensemaking research papers, and how do these affiliations correlate with the citation impact of the papers?

facts.code:
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('outputs/simple_iteration/thread_20250815_002353/dataset_selected.csv')

# Filter papers related to sensemaking
df_sensemaking = df[df['AuthorKeywords'].str.contains('sensemaking', case=False, na=False)]

# Extract author affiliations and citation counts
affiliations = df_sensemaking['AuthorAffiliation'].str.split(';', expand=True).stack()
citation_counts = df_sensemaking['CitationCount_CrossRef'].repeat(affiliations.groupby(level=0).size())

affiliation_citation_df = pd.DataFrame({'Affiliation': affiliations.values, 'CitationCount': citation_counts.values})

# Calculate the most common affiliations and their average citation impact
common_affiliations = affiliation_citation_df['Affiliation'].value_counts().head(5)
avg_citation_impact = affiliation_citation_df.groupby('Affiliation')['CitationCount'].mean().loc[common_affiliations.index]

# Print the results
print("### Begin of facts")
print("Most common author affiliations in sensemaking research:")
print(common_affiliations)
print("\nAverage citation impact of these affiliations:")
print(avg_citation_impact)
print("### End of facts")
